Package io.github.ai4ci.util

Class Cloner

java.lang.Object
io.github.ai4ci.util.Cloner
public class Cloner extends Object
Utility for performing deep object copying via serialisation.

This class provides high-performance deep copy functionality using custom byte stream implementations that avoid synchronisation overhead.

Unlike shallow copies produced by Object.clone(), deep copies ensure complete independence between original and copied objects by serialising the entire object graph.

Performance characteristics include:

  • Custom buffering with geometric growth: use b_{n+1} = max(s, 2*b_n)
  • Stream operations without synchronisation overhead
  • Size estimation for optimal buffer pre-allocation

All serialised objects must implement Serializable to ensure compatibility with the underlying Java serialisation mechanism.

Author:
Rob Challen

  • Method Details

    • copy

      public static <X extends Serializable> X copy(X orig)
      Creates a deep copy of a serialisable object using optimised buffers.

      This method provides a convenient interface for deep copying objects with automatic size estimation and optimised buffer management. For objects larger than \[ 2^{31}-8 \] bytes, the method delegates to SerializationUtils.clone(Serializable) for safety.

      Type Parameters:
      X - the type of object being copied, must extend Serializable
      Parameters:
      orig - the original object to copy
      Returns:
      a deep copy of the original object
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if serialisation process fails

    • copy

      public static <X extends Serializable> X copy(X orig, long estimatedSize)
      Creates a deep copy with explicit size estimation for optimal performance.

      This method provides a memory-efficient deep copy operation with optimised buffer allocation using the estimated size. The buffer size is calculated as 110% of the estimated size to balance between memory usage and the likelihood of needing to resize during serialisation, as empirical testing suggests that where buffer over-allocation by 10% minimises re-sizing overhead.

      Type Parameters:
      X - the serialisable object type
      Parameters:
      orig - object to copy
      estimatedSize - estimated serialisation size for buffer optimisation
      Returns:
      independent deep copy of original object
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - on serialisation errors

    • estimateSize

      public static long estimateSize(Object obj)
      Estimates serialisation size without storing actual data.

      This method calculates the estimated byte count required to serialise an object.

      The estimation employs a MockOutputStream that tracks size without data storage, providing memory-efficient size prediction for buffer allocation optimisation in subsequent copy operations.

      Parameters:
      obj - object to estimate serialisation size for
      Returns:
      estimated bytes required for serialisation \[ \geq 0 \]
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if serialisation fails during estimation
